revised_title: Tercentenary Celebrations of the Royal Society
tldr: The article provides a foreword by the President, H. W. Florey, recounting the Tercentenary Celebrations of the Royal Society. It expresses gratitude to the staff, hosts, and hostesses for their contributions to the event, as well as thanking the bearers of congratulatory addresses from various institutions. The article also acknowledges the efforts of Sir Cyril Hinshelwood, Sir Harold Hartley, and other officers for making the celebrations a notable occasion.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
